item.title: Create certification authority (CA) and self-signed certificates in Linux
item.description:
At first a student will establish a Certified Authority and sign a certificate for the other student’s page. We will then test it on the Apache and Nginx web servers.

Create the certifying authority

Step 1: Creating directories and files

The first step will be to generate a directory in which you will locate your certification authority, in order to maintain an organization at all times. The directory name will be CA /. In turn, you have to generate several subdirectories within it:

item.title: Forensic computer
item.description: Forensics is the set of techniques that allows us to obtain as much information as possible after a computer incident or crime. In this practice, you will perform the evidence-taking and analysis phase on one Linux machine and another Windows. We’ll assume we caught the criminal ‘in fraganti’ and the machines were on. Optionally, you can perform an Android device analysis. On each of the machines you must do a memory and a hard drive, taking the necessary measures to certify the chain of custody.
